content.rendered:
Conventional
Loans

Lower Rates & Better Terms
Apply in Minutes
  • Your Lender for Conventional Home Loans in moonlight - Low Rates, Low Fees & Fast Closings

moonlight Conventional Loans

About Conventional: 

* Freddie Mac and Fannie Mae Insured
* Primary, Second, or Investment Property
* Single, Multi-family or Condo
* $647,250 Max loan
* High Balance – 95% Loan to Value
* 97% Loan to Value
* Mortgage Insurance Options
* Lower Rates & Better Terms
* Manufactured Housing OK (Subject to Restrictions)

Conventional home loans is one of the most popular types of loans in moonlight and a great choice for many home buyers. Conventional mortgages can be used to purchase primary, secondary, and investment properties. Conventional mortgages are ideal for borrowers that have higher credit scores and have different criteria as the loans are guaranteed by Fannie Mae or Freddie Mac. As such, conventional loans usually require less documentation than VA loans, FHA loans, or USDA loans which makes for easier qualifying.  

Conventional Loan Advantages

Why are conventional mortgages so popular in moonlight? 

  • You can avoid purchasing private mortgage insurance
  • You can select a term length that works for you
  • Loans are processed quickly
  • Flexible down payment


If you want to purchase a home this year, you may be able to qualify for a moonlight conventional loan. Here’s what you need to know about applying and qualifying for a conventional loan in moonlight.

While conventional loans come with more rigorous standards than most government-backed loans, they offer several unique benefits that make them a good mortgage option for first-time homebuyers. 

Conventional Fixed

getting rates...

30 Year Fixed

Low payments that never change

*Rate Assumptions

Minimum FICO Credit Score

620

Minimum Down Payment

3% - 5%

Maximum Loan To Value

97%*

45%*

Except Onse To 50%

Special Qualification Requirements

NONE

Why Choose Lone Star Financing ?

Headquartered in Grapevine, moonlight, Lone Star Financing specializes in new home purchases and refinance.  We do thousands of conventional loans every year and our loan officers have the experience to structure your loan tailored to your lending needs. As a direct lender, we offer a full line of home loan products (Conventional, FHA, VA and USDA Loans). At Lone Star Financing our motto is “Low rates, Low fees, and Fast Closings”. Let’s us give you a free no cost estimate and we look forward to earning your business. 

Apply Now

More on Conventional Loans in moonlight

Before you apply for a Conventional loan, there are a few things you need to know about moonlight loan limits and 2022 requirements. It’s important to understand these limits and requirements before you apply. More on moonlight conventional loans. 

Conventional Loan Limits

Loan limits for conventional range from $80,000 (Lone Star minimum loan value to $647,250 (maximum moonlight conventional loan value).

Minimum, you will need a 620 credit score to qualify for a conventional mortgage. However, for the best mortgage rates we recommend our borrowers have a minimum credit score of 740 (for best rates).  

The rule of thumb for conventional loan down payments is 20%, but it is possible you can put down as little as 3%.

 

Nonconforming

Non-conforming loans are loans that do not conform to the guidelines of Fannie Mae or Freddie Mac. The most common types of non-conforming loans are government-backed mortgages – like FHA, USDA and VA loans – and jumbo loans that are above Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac limits.

  • A nonconforming mortgage is a home loan that does not adhere to government-sponsored enterprises (GSE) guidelines and, therefore, cannot be resold to agencies such as Fannie Mae or Freddie Mac.
  • These loans often carry higher interest rates than conforming mortgages.
  • Mortgages that exceed the conforming loan limit are classified as nonconforming and are called jumbo mortgages.

Lone Star Financing - Conventional Loans

Have Questions? Let's Talk

Speak to a Loan Officer - Quick Rate Quote
